long: Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "light", literally ("swift", "small", "sharp", etc.) or figuratively ("easy", "trifling", "vile", etc.).  Usage: abate, make bright, bring into contempt, (ac-) curse, despise, (be) ease(-y, -ier), (be a, make, make somewhat, move, seem a, set) light(-en, -er, -ly, -ly afflict, -ly esteem, thing), Ã— slight(-ly), be swift(-er), (be, be more, make, re-) vile, whet.  Source: a primitive root;
